revised_title: Enzyme-Catalyzed Reactions in Organic Synthesis: Advances and Future Prospects
tldr: This article discusses the use of enzymes in organic synthesis, focusing on the advancements made in the past eight years. It highlights the use of hydrolase and oxidoreductase enzymes in key transformations, as well as the potential of multi-enzyme systems for complex end-product synthesis. The article also explores the use of enzymes in low-water systems and their potential for future research.
